bleedingPrediction.noPrediction: As soon as you have tracked 3 menstrual cycles, drip will make predictions for the next ones.

aboutSection.text:
Please note that your data is stored locally on your phone and not on a server. This means your data cannot be read by anyone else unless they have access to your phone. We want to ensure that you stay in control of your own data. If you are planning to switch or reset your phone, please remember to export your data before doing so. You can reinstall the app afterwards and import your data.

If you encounter any technical issues, don't hesitate to contact us via email. You can also contribute to the code base on Gitlab and visit our website.
aboutSection.title: About

credits.note: We love the drip team. Thanks and lots of <3 to all of our condriputors. Thanks to Paula HÃ¤rtel for the symptom tracking icons. All the other icons are made by {{links.smashicons.url}}, {{links.pause08.url}}, {{links.kazachek.url}} & {{links.freepik.url}} from {{links.flaticon.url}}.
credits.title: Credits

errors.noData: There is no data to delete

deleteSegment.explainer: Delete app data from this phone
deleteSegment.message: Please note that deletion of the app data is permanent and irreversible. We recommend exporting existing data before deletion.

donate.note: The drips are always grateful for donations, big or small, that help us maintain this app and develop new features. You can donate via Ko-fi. Thank you! You're awesome.
donate.title: Buy us a coffee!

errors.futureEdit: Future dates may only contain a note, no other symptoms
errors.postFix: No data was imported or changed

import.message:
There are two options for the import:
1. Keep existing cycle days and replace only the ones in the import file.
2. Delete all existing cycle days and import cycle days from file.
import.title: Keep existing data?

dataManagement.title: Data

nfpSettings.text: define how you want to use NFP
nfpSettings.title: NFP settings

passwordSettings.backupReminder:
Just to be safe, please backup your data using the export function before making changes to your password.

Longer passwords are better! Consider using a passphrase.

Please also make sure you do not lose your password. There is no way to recover your data if you do.

Making any changes to your password setting will keep your data as it was before and restart the app.
passwordSettings.backupReminderTitle: Read this before making changes to your password
passwordSettings.deleteBackupReminder:
Deleting your password means your data will no longer be encrypted.

Just to be safe, please backup your data using the export function before deleting your password.

Making any changes to your password setting will keep your data as it was before and restart the app.
passwordSettings.deleteBackupReminderTitle: Read this before deleting your password
passwordSettings.explainerDisabled: Encrypt the app's database with a password. You need to enter the password every time the app is started.
passwordSettings.explainerEnabled: Password protection and database encryption is currently enabled
passwordSettings.title: App password

periodReminder.notification: Your next period is likely to start in 3 to {{daysToEndOfPrediction}} days.
periodReminder.reminderText: Get a notification 3 days before your next period is likely to start.
periodReminder.title: Next period reminder

philosophy.text: drip makes period predictions for you and helps you apply NFP fertility awareness rules. But please remember that this app is made by humans, and humans make mistakes. Always think for yourself: "Does this make sense?" Remember, you don't need an app to understand your cycle! However, drip wants to support you and make period tracking easier, more transparent and secure.
philosophy.title: Remember to think for yourself

preOvu.note: drip applies NFP's rules for calculating infertile days at the start of the cycle (see {{wiki.url}} for more info). However, drip does not currently apply the so called 20-day-rule, which determines infertile days at the cycle start from past cycle lengths in case no past symptothermal info is available.
preOvu.title: Infertile days at cycle start

tempReminder.noTimeSet: Set a time for a daily reminder to take your temperature

useCervix.cervixModeOff: By default, cervical mucus values are being used for symptothermal fertility detection. You can switch here to use cervix values for symptothermal fertility detection

useCervix.title: Secondary symptom
